column5: You mean like this Rick??????
One word   CHILAXIN
yeah baby - sweet! . downriggers at dawn in first class
33 mph feels pretty fast in my 15 footer LOL  i can't imagine tickling 60 in a ranger.  close to the water and barely any hull touching it.

@ Brian With a 3' Al folding ramp, Sean rolls easy from dock to deck & tons of room for maneuverability  Sure beats the lift set up & tear down as well as limited room on board the Sylvan. Which BTW is not going anywhere  @ Dave Yeppir, most of the better mfrs now offer a 3rd toon which runs deeper than the outer toons. Supposedly for improved steering (which I believe is true) as well as improved stability in 'open water' ???? As for the power, I would probably upgrade to a 90 max. Primary need is accessibility but we would see some recreational use as well.  @ Mr. G Thx for the advice, will definitely consider. Pikeslayer take a peek at this......E-TEC Pontoon Series  http://www.boattest.com/engine-review/Evinrude/18000072_E-TEC-90-Pontoon-Series_2014  Also available in 65 HP, 115 HP and 150 HP.....  http://www.evinrude.com/en-us/engines/pontoon_engines/etec_65_pontoon

33 mph feels pretty fast in my 15 footer LOL  i can't imagine tickling 60 in a ranger. close to the water and barely any hull touching it. One word Raf AWESOME. The pad on the 89 ranger was what I fell in love with and why I rebuilt it instead of buying a new one. This was the last year before they changed to a different design and it feels rock solid. The weight of the older boats makes for a solid ride with out flexing when you hit a wake and keeps the pad from rocking on and off when passing thru a wake.  Art

Yamaha G3 Deep V Angler 17' Yamaha 90 hp Four Stroke Stainless prop  70 km/h when alone with no gear 60-65 km/h with riggers, gear, food, ice, etc   It gets up on plane super fast and is plenty good for fishing, but I really want to see how she'd run at the maximum rating of 150 hp for those days when we're boarding and tubing instead of fishing. It's a slug with 4 adults and some gear on board.

Ha with those wimpy 'toons. My neighbour at the cottage owns one of the local marinas. He recently delivered a pontoon to a customer that was a bohoemouth (think pulp fiction). This thing had an 8.1 I/O out back. 496 cubic inch big block pushing 425 hp. This thing was just downright STUPID. It'll go well into the 50s maybe even low 60s. A pontoon boat!!!
I also have an older Ranger. Mine is a '94 with the VS hull that has the built-in 15" setback. It's one hand on the wheel and rock solid at 63 mph.

....I like that currently in the Lookie stage for one of those to rebuild think it would make a great winter project ..did you remove cap and all Art ? With a Ranger, the cap cannot come off, the only way to replace the transom is to cut the splashwell. To do the stringers, I have no idea.
08 Lund pro-v.200 4cyl verado,9.9 pro thrust,80lb Minn-kota Terrova,4 batteries,25 litre of fuel, 54mph at 6600rpm. 3ft waves fully loaded wife and dog 130litres+  5800rpms.48mph.
1999 lowe 160sc with a 40hp, leaks like crazy but goes 30 mph, 27 loaded according to my navionics Iphone app
Ranger 620VS, 225 Merc Optimax, 9.9 Pro Kicker, Minn Kota 101lbs, 4 batteries and 189 Litres (50US gallons) of fuel I get 58mph. With 1/4 tank of fuel she'll do 62mph.

08 Lund pro-v.200 4cyl verado,9.9 pro thrust,80lb Minn-kota Terrova,4 batteries,25 litre of fuel, 54mph at 6600rpm. 3ft waves fully loaded wife and dog 130litres+  5800rpms.48mph.  Better not let Joey hear you say that. A comma would have saved your skin.
1996 18.5 Seaswirl Striper with a 2000 175 Evinrude Ficht runs at 50mph at 5500. 19" SS Viper propeller.Love this boat, don't know what I'd replace it with if the day ever comes.
16' Legend ProSport tiller (ha) with 30hp Honda 27.5mph solo, 24-25 with one or two two passengers
30 MPH, but I don't care as long as it gets me to where the fish are  . I think now it's about fuel consumption and quietness, no smoke.
Bernie!! Did you get much more boat lift or more bow lift from the viper, An is it 3 or 4 blade. Very interested in this prop.
Better not let Joey hear you say that. A comma would have saved your skin. But it's Joey that want's to go faster.

Made a world of difference in the performance. The previous model year of my boat the complaint was that that it porpoises too easily. So the next model year they actually put a slight hook in the hull to make it run flatter. Trouble was it overdid it and it wouldn't come up. So I had heard the Viper prop would help and put it on. I can actually get it to porpoise without blowing out. Gained 5mph. Nothing but good things to say about it.

1999 Skeeter SS 90  90 hp merc (two stroke)  20 pitch lazer stainless prop  pro comp 6 inch jack plate (set back is 6 inches)  1 inch above pad................. 49 mph (78 kph) loaded for tournament and 53 mph (85 kph) just me and some gear full tank of gas and 3 batteries  (my buddies call it the purple rocket)
2001 17' Legend with 75HP Merc, 42 mph with no passenger, 5250 rpm.
Lund 1600 Fury tiller 40 hp Mercury EFI 4 stroke. 4 blade factory recommended prop. 5950 rpm 30 mph solo. 27 mph with two more and our gear.
20' Allison xb2003 with a 150 Merc xr6, 80mph solo, 75 loaded with two guys. 26 pitch over hub prop, nose coned case turning 6700 rpm

2150 Lund Baron 275 Verado 9.9 Kicker and lots of other heavy stuff. Fishing gear alone probably 300 to 400 pounds.  Generally I run it about 65 MPH, but sometimes I get up to 80 when I pull out to pass.  Once off loaded at the launch I like to cruise it at 34 MPH as it's the sweet spot for economy on the 275 Verado at about 9.8 usGPH which is a LOT less fuel than my old 115 2 stroke Johnson burnt just pushing a 17' Glastron at the same speed. But if I feel like burning gas or racing the bass boats it'll do 53 mph while drinking 32 usGPH.

2150 Lund Baron 275 Verado 9.9 Kicker and lots of other heavy stuff. Fishing gear alone probably 300 to 400 pounds.  Generally I run it about 65 MPH, but sometimes I get up to 80 when I pull out to pass.  Once off loaded at the launch I like to cruise it at 34 MPH as it's the sweet spot for economy on the 275 Verado at about 9.8 usGPH which is a LOT less fuel than my old 115 2 stroke Johnson burnt just pushing a 17' Glastron at the same speed. But if I feel like burning gas or racing the bass boats it'll do 53 mph while drinking 32 usGPH. Aren't smartcraft gauges great? My former boat, I did a max of 58 mph. It was a Ranger 370V pushed by a 150 Optimax. My current boat will touch 42 mph and burn a heck of a lot more fuel. However the 9.9 4 stroke kicker will very comfortably do 1.1 - 6.4 mph.
I test drived this ride for 3 days this past week for an accessibility evaluation. Harris Cruiser 200 modestly powered by a Merc 50        Top speed 19 MPH !!!!!!    Nice ride though

I test drived this ride for 3 days this past week for an accessibility evaluation. Harris Cruiser 200 modestly powered by a Merc 50        Top speed 19 MPH !!!!!!    Nice ride though  What, no Tiki bar.   ^^^^^^^^^^  Lots of them these days Simon on Simcoe here.  Even have two that are rigged up with down riggers. Now thats layed back and relaxed.

A friend on another lake up here has one of those speedy pontoons. His is a triple tube 20 something foot deal with a giant OB on the back. The thing flies!!!! Even with 8 or 10 people on it. I think it has a 150 or 200 on the back.

Pikeslayer, nice looking rig...........very nice..........  The only thing I would change is the power station on the back "IF" you can........ E-TEC makes a pontoon special outboard in a 90 hp and I THINK a 60 hp that is gear for those pontoon boats. VERY quiet and very easy to put away because they put themselves to sleep for the winter. My son rented one in late June on a family vacation and I was VERY impressed.

A friend on another lake up here has one of those speedy pontoons. His is a triple tube 20 something foot deal with a giant OB on the back. The thing flies!!!! Even with 8 or 10 people on it. I think it has a 150 or 200 on the back.   I was very impressed with the one I seen Dave. You talk about a hole shot. Could make a bass boat owner cry, hell, even wet his pants. LOL Well maybe not fast, but for a toon, it was fine.
Nice Simon     Blue zone in first class

Which BTW is not going anywhere  @ Dave Yeppir, most of the better mfrs now offer a 3rd toon which runs deeper than the outer toons. Supposedly for improved steering (which I believe is true) as well as improved stability in 'open water' ???? As for the power, I would probably upgrade to a 90 max. Primary need is accessibility but we would see some recreational use as well.  @ Mr. G Thx for the advice, will definitely consider.

Definitely not haha. Strictly cottage boat. The package we trialled was definitely not suited to fishing. I'm trying to get the 'fishing' package demo lined up for next trip in 2 weeks.  ps. You sayin the Sylvan is 2nd class?????

Definitely not haha. Strictly cottage boat. The package we trialled was definitely not suited to fishing. I'm trying to get the 'fishing' package demo lined up for next trip in 2 weeks.  ps. You sayin the Sylvan is 2nd class????? welll,,,,, ya know... the thought of stretching out here,,,, one eye on the rigger, coffee cup resting on the seat next to me....of course you're the Captain so you would have to be at the helm..... I mean come on... the sylvan's nice, but this is CLASS..   but seriously - awesome set up for Sean

04 Crestliner 1600 Angler w/05 50 hp Johnson 2 stroke. 31 solo in optimum conditions, 29 mph with a partner. Max cap rated for a 75 but if I can get insurance to strap a 90 hp 2 stroke Yammie (Only 60 lb heavier than the 50) on the transom who knows what she'll top out at but I'd like to find out.
12 ft port-a-bote with a 2 hp evinrude under ideal conditions alone maybe about 7-8 mph,with the 5 hp nissan I may hit about 15 mph.

on a dead still calm day, 2mph, with my oars and my 8ft inflatable fish hunter, with the wind, whatever speed the wind is going, can make a nice sail with my jacket and oars, against the wind is dead slow and painful

21ft Lowe Fishing Machine with Evinrude 150hp Ficht Ram Injection 2-stroke with stainless 4 blade prop (can't remember the pitch or dia, we have it in the file though if anyone wants it) - 52mph empty with one person & ~43mph with 4 people, 2 dogs and gear. (Father's boat)  12ft Salter Mountaineer inflatable -20hp Suzuki DT20 2-stroke - 32mph empty with one person & ~25mph with 2 people and gear. -55lb trolling motor I get just under 5mph on a good day. -On lakes that don't allow motors - depends on how much caffeine I've had.
2006 Princecraft 16' starfish tinny, 20HP yamaha 2stroke just me 300lbs+gear 23mph(GPS) me and 1 kid 20-21mph me and another 300lbs guy 19mph 3 of us 17mph

2008 Smokercraft Pro V 182.  18.2 feet, with 8 foot beam.  Powered by 115HP Mercury Optimax.  With 2 people, and full load of gear/tank, I have had it as high as 42MPH - WOT.  Or course it was as smooth as glass that time.  Average is more like 40 to 41 MPH, via the GPS.  RPM's show 6000 - but I doubt that gauge.  There is supposed to be an over speed warning at 5800 (or so) and a limiter at 6000. Running a 3 Blade 21P.  Thinking of going to a 4 blade 19P, maybe next year.
I've got a 1978 Seahorse on a 16 foot canoe, according to my GPS I hit 9Kph with the wind at my back!
2009 Legend ProSport 16sc with a 1994 Force 40hp 2 stroke.  Just me and usual fishing gear, 30mph.  With 2 or 3 fellas 25mph.
Stratos 176XT... 75 Optimax....40 mph...
Fastest I've had our boat going was just under 50mph indicated on the GPS.
1991 Suzuki DT15C  Solo with gear 32kph  with fishing partner 21kph
Lund ProV DLX 1890, Merc 115 2 stroke.  Fastest Ive got it was 43.5 MPH
2006 Alumacraft Fisherman 145 with 30 HP 2014 Evenrude ETEC - 2 ppl with gear 22 Mph, solo - 24 Mph

Larson 190 Fish n ski, 4.3 Volvo Penta 48mph with trolling motor batteries, gear and a full tank of fuel. Mind you, I rarely rip it that fast, waay too hard on the wallet. I normally cruise at about 24-28mph.
Lately not fast enough! to much fine foods?  lol   Art
1989 Ranger 350V  GTX 150 modified 62 MPH 2 men and gear.  Art
2050 Crestliner with a 300 Mercury Verado. Four guys with fuel and gear 55 mph. Had it going 65 mph lightly loaded.
Crestliner Fish Hawk 1650, 90HP Merc 4 Stroke, 44MPH on GPS - just me in it...
175 Cajun with a 150 Merc with just me and a slight ripple on the water it will hit 59 mph
2008 tracker targa 18.5 w 150 merc optimax Solo w gear 42 mph fully loaded w 3 guys 36 mph all day
Mid eighties 13 foot Landau tinny. Nothing to it. With the 1957 10 horse Johnson it's" too fast, too fast for love......."
2010 Sylvan 1600 explorer side console with 60 Yamaha 4stroke, 35 MPH alone I run at 5000 rpm with 2 people at 30 mph
Wow, lots of fast vessels here and a much bigger response to this thread then I could of imagined.
About 26 hours on Craig's list! LOL
2006 1625 lund classic tiller with a 2011 yamaha 50hp four stroke,loaded with gas and gear solo 34mph,with 2 loaded about 32mph on gps !!!!
Cliff, is that the boat you did up yourself?
1986 scorpion 187,305 v8,200 I/O 4 guys and gear,42 mph with Gps.Close to 50 mph alone.17 pitch aluminum prop.Way better hole shot then the SS21.
Brian.  Yep!  Redid all the electrical and the floors and with help from Will and Bernie, I installed the seat bases etc.
Brian. Yep! Redid all the electrical and the floors and with help from Will and Bernie, I installed the seat bases etc. Nicely done !!
Brian. Yep! Redid all the electrical and the floors and with help from Will and Bernie, I installed the seat bases etc.   Thats beautiful work bud. Love the layout.
Thanks guys!   This was the before pic....
Cinder block anchor. Classic. LOL
Ranger 487VS with a 200 EFI Mariner Magnum. 23P 4 blade Trophy Plus prop. 64 MPH with two people. I could go up to a 25P 3 blade to win some top end but I like the bite of the 4 blade on Erie.
Fast enough to take your hat off.
Wooden row boat - with oars - about 1 mph - with me and the dog - fast enough for me -
2010 Stratos 285XL DC with ETEC 150HO, 24 pitch Raker.  60 - 61 mph GPS with me and my fiance and 3/4 tank of fuel.
Cool thread.  My lund wc-12 w/ 2008 Merc 15hp 2stroke will do 24-25 mph by myself (which is downright haywire in a 12 footer solo) and 18-20 mph with 2 guys and gear.
2011 txw tracker with a 60 merc 4stroke ,,,,2 guys,,,,37 mph
Lately not fast enough!

10.6 Foot Mercury fibreglass bottom RIB with 8 hp Yamaha.  With me solo and my fishing gear, 17mph flat out.  It goes about 38 mph when attached to the back of the Sea Ray mother ship, burning about 50 gallons (180 litres) per hour at WOT.
Lately not fast enough!  You dont need a boat. You have a mobile living van that can come up and fish knox. lol. I even know another spot close by there you can set up and spend a couple of days.

You dont need a boat. You have a mobile living van that can come up and fish knox. lol. I even know another spot close by there you can set up and spend a couple of days.  I'll be there by months end.

As for the boat.  2006 Lund Explorer 1700. 75 Merc 4 stroke tiller, goes like stink. Two guys and gear with 27 gals. fuel I have had her up to 42 mph. However, hard to handle the tiller with no hull in the water, comfortably 36 to 38 all day long. Now if I could just tap into the extra 15 horse that exists under the cowling....

Cool thread.  My lund wc-12 w/ 2008 Merc 15hp 2stroke will do 24-25 mph by myself (which is downright haywire in a 12 footer solo) and 18-20 mph with 2 guys and gear.  Ya some of the hairiest rides I've had were in a little aluminum with a way too big motor on the back. Likely felt way faster than it actually was but still that thing would just up and go then skip along, one hand on the tiller the other on the gunwale.
Oh yeah.  Mine is coast-guard approved for a 15, though.
Ours was rated for exactly what the stickers on the cowling said it was rated for.
StarCraft Superfisherman 190. 115 Mariner and 15 Mariner kicker, 450 pounds of fishermen and all equipment, 35 MPH, at 4500 RPM,

For years I had a 14' aluminum with a 35hp Merc tiller. That little bugger flew. Didn't seem to matter how many people you had in the boat either! Lol I have to admit I love the stability of the Ranger at top end. I think the tinny felt faster though.
My '89 Starcraft 17' side console went 40 mph with a 115 yamaha 4 stroke, new Kingfisher Flex 2025 with Suzuki 225 four stroke runs 54 mph, all on GPS.
1991 Fisher SV18-GT with a 2013 Merc 115 hp 4 stroke. With a full load of fuel me, the dog and supplies for the weekend @ the cabin 42MPH @ 5850 RPM. Cruise is 27-28 MPH @ 3950 RPM.

This thread can help others when choosing a boat and motor and what to expect.  Polar Kraft Frontier 179WT with a 90 HO E-TEC 42.2 mph alone with a half tank of gas but 40 mph all day long with 2 or 3 anglers.
1994 17.5' Starcraft Super fisherman 90 HP s stroke Mariner  115 KPH on the 401  36-38MPH on the water tops full fuel and people
2001 Lund Sendero 1650, 2005 Yamaha F90, 39-42 mph. Love the Michigan Wheel Products Apollo SS 19" prop, noticable performance gain bottom to top.

2008 Princecraft Pro174SS, 90 4S Merc on rear.....120KPH all day with Ford F150 on front.... 38-40MPH on the water 2 up without the truck...  I guess my take on this is really who cares about a top speed. If ya wanna go faster go bigger in general terms.
2003? Princecraft 164 Pro Series with a 2004 50hp 4 stroke Johnson    Loaded with gear, me and my brother 42kph easy. Without my brother 50kph. all based on the gps.
WX1880 Skeeter with a 150 Yamaha  51-52 MPH with just me in the boat  and a couple MPH less with a partner.
363v ranger 18ft bass boat 1992 evinrude intruder150hp 61mph at 5500 rpm
1998 lund explorer 1600 2012 Yamaha 50hp 4stroke Full gear and 3 guys I'm around 27 mph Just me 30-33 mph
2001 starcraft 160 starfire sc with a 2004 70 hp johnson(suzuki) 4 stroke  2 people  35 mph.whole family with the dogs 30mph.
My nissan 9.9 will do a whole 20kph on a car topper, My 91 chaparral 20 ft with the v8 305 used to do 50mph with just me but now its about 47, boat full of people it will still go over 30mph.
17 ft Lund tiller ..60 Yamaha tiller high thrust ..me and full tank fuel 34-35 mph ...loaded 30 mph all day
2011 Stratos  486 - 18.5' long a 2 stroke merc 150. With just me around 60 MPH with a second person about 55.
15' mirrocraft striker, 40 hp yamaha tiller, 33mph alone.  cruises nicely at 19-21.
2000 Legend V-165 Scorpion with a 40 Merc 2-stroke.  30 mph alone, 27-28 mph with two guys and gear and a long runway.

2006 Bass Tracker 190 TX w/ 75 Merc four stoke.  36-37mph full tournament load or 38mph with me and my gear at 5500rpm.  That's with a 17p aluminum prop. I can hit 40 with a 19p aluminum but I lose some maneuverability.
Lund Rebel 1440V and 30hp Evinrude E-Tec: solo does 27mph, 2 people approx 25mph.
16ft starcraft widebody tiller with 40 mariner.  30mph solo with the wind at my back, around 27-29 with 3 ppl and gear.  Loaded with 3 guys and full of decoys, about 24mph.  S.
9ft pontoon,2 flipper human powered,loaded with me and gear, 1.2 mph max.
I was waiting for you to post.
I was waiting for you to post.

99 Lund rebel side console with 50hp honda.  Best conditions, with 2 and gear, 30MPH.  Don't know how much more I could get with a different prop, as that is close to redline.  I generally run around 26-27mph when I need to get somewhere.
Had a 12 foot tinner, 6 hp Johnson. Me alone, 19 km/hour. Add a second person and it would drop to 11 or 12km/h.  Calm conditions.
22 ft century hardtop,  5.0l inboard.   40 mph if you have deep pockets.....likes to cruise around 25-30 mph.
2013 16'8" Alumacraft Competitor with 90hp 4 stroke Yamaha - tops out at 42 mph
14" tinny with floors and a 25hp motor.  Runs at 25 mph with two guys and fishing gear.
